intro: Psoralea palmata, commonly known as the palmate psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its palmately compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Psoralea palmata is adapted to arid environments and is known for its drought tolerance. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
